data.title: Great Place
data.text: Owner is a pleasure very attentive. Food quality and taste is amazing. Great hidden gem in CS.  The chicken with curry was amazing the skirt steak as well. Everything we ordered was perfect.

data.title: Delicious Fusion
data.text: This was our second visit and both times, we've had good food and great service.  The owner is Argentinian; his wife is Korean and the combination just works!  We ordered the Provoleta appetizer and it was every bit as good as the ones we had while in Argentina several years ago.  For entrees, we got the chicken Milanese A Caballo (fried chicken steak with fried eggs...we had also had this unique (to us) combination on steak sandwiches for the first time in Buenos Aries).  We also ordered Spicy Pork, served with kimchi, pickled radishes and cucumbers.  Everything was delicious and the owner/ waiter was gracious and interesting.  We'll be back.

data.title: Unique & Delicious
data.text:
Had the Dumplings and the Spicy Pork. Utterly delicious. My friend had the Bimimap (sp) which she loved.

Service was a little strange but nothing to keep me from returning. Korean and Argentinean and then some fusion dishes as well.

data.title: Very Authentic Korean Food
data.text: There are not a lot of Korean restaurants in this are so I tried this one out on a whim.  It's very cozy (reminds me of when I was in Okinawa) and the Kimchi and Bugolgi was very good.  I will definitely return.

data.title: Found this hidden gem while looking for 'something new'
data.text: We decided to try this place before heading to the movies but we wanted to try something new. When we first entered, the décor is simple, pleasant, and clean. We were greeted by the owner who was very welcoming and informative. We started with a couple of Korean appetizers: Kimchee pancakes and Korean pan-fried dumplings. The flavors and textures were spot-on. Next we had our entrees, my wife and children had the Milanese with a soft-fried egg which the owner insists is the style that soccer great, Lionel Messi orders all the time. I had the Korean short-ribs and made sure to try all the Korean condiments and the hot sauce which was very helpful in clearing my sinuses. The menu is minimalistic but there are plenty of options to suit anyone's tastes and a great introduction to Korean and Argentinian cuisine. We are happy to have found another place we look forward to trying again.

data.title: Wonderful all around
data.text: The owners are welcoming and sweet! Their food is made with love and you can feel the warmth. I would tell anyone to try it out. The beef was tender and the vegetables fresh.

data.title: Amazing Fusion Food
data.text: To start the moment we walked in we were greeted by the Argentinian owner with a great big warm hello and welcome to our restaurant. Upon being handed the menu the owner asked if we needed any explaining and of course since we never ate Argentinian or Korean food we asked. He explained what Kimchee was and explained all the fusions and appetizers, and recommended the Mandoo which were pan fried dumplings full of flavor. For dinner he recommended Kalbi short ribs with mild Korean spices great flavor and a large portion of meat, my wife had chicken with vegetables over rice with a Korean curry sauce. We will be going back to try more off the menu., A plus the restaurant was extremely clean.

data.title: Table 4 two!
data.text: I kept passing by   Chimi and Kimchi  Grill  and  said that one day I will eat there!. AFTER  a few day  going out to my regular stops.  I Wanted something new so  I went Korean! Chimi and Kimchi Grill was Nice atmosphere ! Food come in a timely fashion!  Most excellent presentation, flavor ,and the right kind of  spicy! If your debating; I would like to recommend this experience !

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: I had been eyeing this place for about a year before I went there for lunch this week. Chef owner is from Argentina and wife is Korean, hence the name.  I had the Bimibop with Chicken, which is a large bowl of flavorful rice topped with vegetable and chicken, with an egg on top. Owner told me to stir it all up with the chimichuro sauce. It was delicious and filling, very fresh clean ingredients. Espresso for dessert was rich and strong. I can't wait to go back and try something else. They serve dinner as well and have wine and beer.

data.title: Terrific!
data.text: What an amazing fusion Argentinian and Korean and they do it great! Food is really different appetizing and delicious! Best to order from both sides of the menu and SHARE, FUN and interesting dining experience  good value!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
Can't believe that every review praised this restaurant and the " friendly, gracious" owners.
We were there on a busy night.  The owner never smiled or was friendly in any way.  Seemed overwhelmed and barely acknowledged us.  They ordered sangria from the menu,and were told that they were out of it.  We ordered two appetizers, empanadas and the dumplings.  The empanadas looked attractive, but were tasteless.  The dumplings were presented well and were good.  We were given paper plates for the appetizers!
Our main course, short ribs were described by others as tender and tasty.  Ours were dry and chewy.  We planned to have the flan for dessert, but since we waited so long for each course, and it was getting late, we just left.  Definitely would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!

data.title: AMAZING!
data.text:
Just stopped in with my dad and Brothers and we had a great time. 
Great food & great Beer! 
Ordered the sampler and the sweetbread and blood sausage was delicious.

data.title: A PLEASANT SURPRISE!
data.text: We were going to the local Indian eatery in the same strip shopping center. When we got there it is closed on Tuesday. My wife spot the CHIMI & KIMCHI GRILL (Argentine and Korean) about ten store west. We said why not. Our motto is you can have only one bad meal in a restaurant. If you have a second one your kinda dumb or a slow learner. Back to CHIMIKIMCHI, first very very clean clean. We each had a chicken empanada. It was very good but  different than the Cuban Cafe. The next dish was UNDONG fish cake, noodles and green onion soup. Very good. The next dish was SPICY SQUID. We ordered the spice level to be between mild and medium. My wife found it a little too spicy but very good. It was served withe typical variety of pickled and spicy side dishes and a bowl of rice. The service was excellent.

data.title: A unique blend of Korean and Argentine!
data.text: Owners are cultured and peaceful people - great food and dining experience! The food can be made spiced if you desire. The sauces and wine availability brings me back often!

data.title: 1st time at Korean Restaurant - so not sure if a 4 or a 5
data.text: food was very good but as this was my 1st attempt at korean food I have nothing to base a comparison on - had the bimibabithing - beef, vegetables, rice with kimchi - needed more kimchi as that was excellent and flavorful, fried egg very good, korean spicy sauce added some warmth to flavor - only negatives were for our soft drink and food we waited 40 minutes - I know it is cooked fresh but anyone with only 1 hour for lunch could not come here as we were not out of there for 75 minutes - and the owner is the cook and server - he has his tablet for payment and tips are on tablet as percentages - DO OWNERS REALLY DESERVE A TIP - they get 100% of profit (my firends mother owned a restaurant and she did not accept tips) tips are for actual wait staff struggling to survive - would go back to try other things

data.title: Great food in a warm and friendly little restaurant
data.text: This was a great find for us, and pretty close to home. We love Korean food, but the two places down in Sunrise are on the pricey side. We didn't get to try any of the Argentinian food, but we loved everything we ordered. Delicious soup, with fresh made dumplings to start. Then three of us shared a kimchi pancake, spicy pork, and beef bulgogi. We didn't leave a bite behind on any plate. All of the traditional Korean side dishes were very fresh and tasty. It's a pretty small store, but decorated nicely, gives it an intimate feel. Our group also included a 3 1/2 year old, and the owner was very accommodating to her needs.

data.title: A real GEM in Coral Springs!
data.text: Food and service so good we ate there 2 nights in a row...and we can't wait to go back, kids and all.  We ate from both sides of the menu (one side is Argentine cuisine, the other Korean), one delectable dish after another were cheerfully delivered to the table by the owner, who remembered the names of our children when we walked in the second night!  The food quality was superb, freshly made in house (we are holistic/clean eaters...I pay attention to the preparation and execution) and traditionally prepared, the way it is meant to be.  Loved the kimchi and the different vegetable dishes.  The squid was perfectly cooked.  So were the sweetbreads.  These two dishes are difficult to perfect, but this place nailed them both.  Very reasonably priced. Our new favorite local restaurant, hands down.  See you soon, ChimiKimchi!

data.title: Go-To for Take Out
data.text: Chimi and Kimchi Grill is one of our go to restaurants for take out.  They are consistently excellent and the owners are always so nice.  They serve both Argentine and Korean cusine-so you can have the best of two very different worlds.  My favorite are the Korean Tacos and my husband almost always orders the Milanesa Napolitana.  We've also have tried the empanadas, very good as well as the flan also very good.  We've ordered at least five or six times and haven't had a bad meal once.
